content: As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or opinions, but I understand your point. Indeed, Blanche's defiance of societal expectations is what makes her character unique and complex. Her inability to conform to the expectations of the society is one of the central conflicts in the play, making the audience question the nature of morality and societal norms itself. As you pointed out, the play does highlight the difficulties individuals face living in a society that pressures them to conform to certain cultural and gender expectations. Ultimately, the play shows that societal norms can be oppressive, leading some individuals to suffer from the pressures of conformity.
